properties.name: Big Ben
properties.description: Posted by Trey325Londonone of the most famous clock face and chimes in the world, Big Ben is actually the name of the biggest bell (13.5 tons) inside The Clock Tower (320ft) which forms part of the HOUSES OF PARLIAMENT.Built in 1858-1859 the bell was named after one Sir Benjamin Hall

properties.name: Massachusetts Historical Society
properties.description: Posted by Trey325massachusettsThe Massachusetts Historical Society is an independent research library that collects, preserves, makes accessible, and communicates manuscripts and other materials in order to promote the study of the history of Massachusetts and the nation-a mission it has pursued since 1791.

properties.name: Pearl Harbor
properties.description: Posted by Trey325pearl harborThe 7 December 1941 Japanese raid on Pearl Harbor was a very sad event. This is when the Japs came in two waves of air crafts and executed an surprise attack on the US. The first hit its target at 7:53 AM, the second at 8:55. By 9:55 it was all over. By 1:00 PM the carriers that launched the planes from 274 miles off the coast of Oahu were heading back to Japan.

properties.name: The Great Wall Of China
properties.description: Posted by Trey325ChinaThe Great Wall of China, one of the greatest wonders of the world, was enlisted in the World Heritage by UNESCO in 1987. Just like a gigantic dragon, the Great Wall winds up and down across deserts, grasslands, mountains and plateaus, stretching approximately 4,163 miles from east to west of China. With a history of more than 2000 years, some of the sections of the great wall are now in ruins or even entirely disappeared.

properties.name: effil tower
properties.description: Posted by Trey325parisThe Eiffel Tower, an immense stucture of exposed latticework supports made of iron, was erected for the Paris Exposition of 1889. The Prince of Wales (later King Edward VII of England) officiated at the ceremonial opening. Of the 700 proposals submitted in a design competition, one was unanimously chosen, a radical creation from the French structural engineer Alexandre Gustave Eiffel,who was assisted in the design by engineers Maurice Koechlin and Emile Nouguier, and architect Stephen Sauvestre.

properties.name: library of congress
properties.description: Posted by Trey325washingtonOn July 4, 1776, the Second Continental Congress, meeting in Philadelphia in the Pennsylvania State House (now Independence Hall), approved the Declaration of Independence, severing the colonies\' ties to the British Crown.

properties.name: mount rushmore
properties.description: Posted by Trey325LocationThe faces of four American presidents: Washington, Jefferson, Teddy Roosevelt, and Lincoln are here.These 60-foot high faces, 500-feet up are the presidents faces.The park has the Avenue of Flags, leading from the Concession Building to the Grandview Terrace. The flags of the 56 states and territories again fly below the Memorial

properties.name: the alamo
properties.description: Posted by Trey325san antonio Mission San Antonio de Valero, later became famous as the Alamo, was established in 1718, the first of five Spanish missions founded in San Antonio to Christianize and educate resident Indians. The church structure that stands today in midtown was begun about 1755.

properties.name: the golden gate bridge
properties.description: Posted by Trey325san franciscoThe Golden Gate Bridge connects San Francisco with Marin County. The Golden Gate Bridge held the title as the longest suspension bridge in the world. In 1937, the bridge was considered impossible to build, due to persistently foggy weather, 60-mile-per-hour winds. the bridge was named "the bridge that couldnt be built". The total cost was 5 million, and the total length of the bridge spans 1.2 miles.

properties.name: the statue of liberty
properties.description: Posted by Trey325new yorkThe Statue of Liberty National Monument officially celebrated her 100th birthday on October 28, 1986. The people of France gave the Statue to the people of the United States over one hundred years ago in recognition of the friendship established during the American Revolution. Over the years, the Statue of Liberty has grown to include freedom and democracy as well as this international friendship.
